raw_text:
Koubek suspended after drugs test
 
 Stefan Koubek says he has been banned for three months by the International Tennis Federation (ITF) after testing positive for a banned substance.
 
 The world number 60 failed a routine drugs test at this year's French Open but now plans to lodge an appeal. Koubek believes an injection given to him by an Austrian doctor to treat a wrist injury is to blame for producing traces of the substance in his system. "I have acted correctly," the 27-year-old Austrian said in a statement. Koubek, who defeated Britain's Greg Rusedski in the decisive rubber of the Davis Cup in September, is now set to miss the start of the season. He said, "A three-month ban would mean that I not only will miss the Australian Open, but also the Davis Cup in Australia."
llama3.2:1b: Stefan Koubek suspended for 3 months after testing positive for a banned substance at French Open. Will appeal, believes doctor's injection may be to blame. Missing start of season and Davis Cup.
llama3.2:3b: Stefan Koubek has been banned for three months by the International Tennis Federation after testing positive for a banned substance during this year's French Open, citing an injection given to treat a wrist injury.
gemma2:2b: Stefan Koubek has been banned for three months by the ITF after testing positive for a banned substance at the French Open.  Koubek claims an injection given to him by an Austrian doctor for a wrist injury caused the positive test and plans to appeal. He will miss the start of the season, including the Australian Open and Davis Cup in Australia.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A 27-year-old Austrian tennis player named Stefan Koubek has been banned from participating in professional tennis for three months by the International Tennis Federation (ITF). He failed a routine drugs test at the French Open and plans to appeal against the ban. Koubek believes an injection given to him by his doctor to treat a wrist injury was responsible for the positive results, and he is set to miss the start of the season after missing two tournaments due to the ban.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Koubek banned for three months by ITF after positive drug test; claims an injection treated a wrist injury, now unable to play due to missed Davis Cup.
qwen2.5:3b: Stefan Koubek was suspended for three months by the International Tennis Federation after testing positive for a banned substance following a drugs test at this year's French Open. He believes an injection given to treat his wrist injury caused the trace. Now set to miss the start of the season, he will not only miss the Australian Open but also the Davis Cup in Australia. Koubek plans to appeal the decision.
opencoder:1.5b: "After a long process of manipulation, Stefan Koubek has been banned for three months from the International Tennis Federation due to the presence of a banned substance."
